001package io.github.ai4ci.output;
002
003import java.util.stream.Stream;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.CSVWriter;
009import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export;
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export.Stage;
011
012/**
013 * Behaviour counts exported during simulation updates in long format.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * Main purpose: provide a long format key/value listing of counts per behaviour
017 * type for a simulation execution. Records are produced at the UPDATE stage and
018 * are aggregated per simulation state (not per individual), and written to a
019 * CSV file ({@code behaviours.csv}).
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * Downstream uses: aggregated behaviour counts are used for trend analysis,
023 * policy evaluation and for combining with other summary outputs.
024 *
025 * @author Rob Challen
026 */
027@Value.Immutable
028@Export(
029                stage = Stage.UPDATE,
030                value = "behaviours.csv",
031                size = 16,
032                selector = OutbreakBehaviourCountCSV.Selector.class,
033                writer = CSVWriter.class
034)
035public interface OutbreakBehaviourCountCSV extends CommonCSV.State {
036
037        /**
038         * Selector for outbreak behaviour count CSV export. This is used to extract
039         * the relevant data from the outbreak state and convert it into a stream of
040         * records to be written to the CSV file.
041         */
042        public class Selector implements Export.Selector {
043
044                @Override
045                public Stream<OutbreakBehaviourCountCSV> apply(Outbreak t) {
046                        return CSVMapper.INSTANCE.toBehaviourCSV(t);
047                }
048
049        }
050
051        /**
052         * Behaviour type key.
053         *
054         * @return the name of the behaviour being counted (key in the long format)
055         */
056        public String getBehaviour();
057
058        /**
059         * Count value for the behaviour.
060         *
061         * @return the frequency count of agents exhibiting the given behaviour in
062         *         the current simulation state
063         */
064        public Long getCount();
065
066        /**
067         * Policy name associated with the count.
068         *
069         * @return the policy label under which the behaviour counts were computed
070         */
071        public String getPolicy();
072
073}
